intro: Myrcia berberis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf myrcia, is a shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It features lanceolate, glossy leaves that are typically dark green and arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental horticulture.
